lead_paragraph: Lewis Hamilton, last year’s Formula One runner-up, was never seriously threatened in winning an accident-filled Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne to open the season. Hamilton, 23, a British driver for McLaren, started from the pole and claimed his fifth victory in 18 Grand Prix starts. He finished in 1 hour 34 minutes 50.616 seconds. BMW-Sauber’s Nick Heidfeld was second, 5.4 seconds back.
